title: Remove Before/After sections and apply premium white + gold light theme

requirements.summary: Remove the entire Before & After / Transformation section from all pages so no related UI or images render.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page no longer renders the BeforeAfterPreview section and there is no empty spacing where it used to be.
Gallery page no longer renders the Transformation Stories/BeforeAfterPair section and there is no empty spacing where it used to be.
No before/after transformation images (e.g., hype-before-1 / hype-after-1) are referenced by any rendered component in the UI.
Build succeeds with no unused-import TypeScript errors after removing the section(s).

file_operations.description: Remove the BeforeAfterPreview import and JSX usage so the Home page no longer renders any transformation section and does not leave an empty gap.
Remove the BeforeAfterPair import and the entire Transformation Stories section block so the Gallery page only renders the facility photo gallery content (no leftover spacing).
Delete the Home-page Before/After preview component to ensure transformation UI and references to before/after assets are removed from the shipped UI code.
Delete the Gallery-page Before/After pair component to ensure transformation UI and references to before/after assets are removed from the shipped UI code.

requirements.summary: Switch the site-wide theme to a premium light look (white base, gold accents) and remove any forced dark-mode behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The app is no longer forced into dark mode (e.g., ThemeProvider is not set to forcedTheme="dark" / defaultTheme="dark").
Global background is light (white or near-white) with dark readable foreground text across all pages.
Gold is the primary accent used consistently for highlights, gradients, borders, icons, and CTA emphasis across the site.
No prominent red/neon-blue accent styling remains in key UI elements (header brand/icon, primary CTA buttons, page title gradients, etc.).

file_operations.description: Update the ThemeProvider configuration to remove forced dark-mode behavior and set the default rendering to light theme (no forcedTheme="dark" / defaultTheme="dark").

Update global CSS variables to a light-first palette (near-white background, dark readable foreground) and define premium gold as the primary accent via theme tokens (e.g., --primary/--accent) so the site renders light by default.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions to align with the new premium light look (e.g., replace any red/neon glow-like styling with subtle gold-compatible shadows/accents) while keeping existing token-based color mapping.

requirements.summary: Replace hard-coded accent OKLCH literals in key UI components with the new gold theme tokens for consistent premium styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Header brand icon/gradient, navigation hover/active styles, and “Join Now” button use the gold accent rather than the old hard-coded OKLCH values.
Hero section accent pill, headline gradient, and CTAs use gold accents consistent with the new theme.
Page title gradient accents (e.g., Gallery/Contact headings) use the new gold accent styling.
Footer accent elements (icons, brand name, heart) use the new gold accent styling.
Accent colors are controlled primarily via theme variables/tokens rather than repeated hard-coded color literals throughout components.

file_operations.description: Replace hard-coded OKLCH accent classes with token-based classes (e.g., primary/accent) for the brand icon, brand gradient text, nav hover/active states, and “Join Now” button so the header uses the new gold accent consistently.

Replace hard-coded OKLCH accent classes with token-based classes for the accent pill, headline gradient, and CTA button styling; update the outline CTA to use the gold token accent (removing the previous non-gold accent).
Update the page title gradient styling to use the new gold token-based accent classes instead of hard-coded OKLCH color literals.
Update the page title gradient styling to use the new gold token-based accent classes instead of hard-coded OKLCH color literals (do not alter the Free Trial form behavior).
Replace hard-coded OKLCH accent classes with token-based classes for footer brand name, social icon hover states, contact icons, and the heart icon so footer accents match the premium gold theme.
